page.title: 14"Newhouse" Farm
page.content: This is a small dairy farm of 10.9 hectares,plus 4 hectares of pasture rented from April to November,worked by the owner and his wife.50 head of Friesians are kept of which 20 cows are milked twice daily by electric air-vacuum pipeline into buckets and emptied into a water-cooled bulk tank, the rest are steers and heifer replacements.Ryecorn is sown in Autumn giving an early 'bite' in Spring for cowfeed.Later 'stubble turnips broadcast',for cattle to graze on.The amount of grass for feed is controlled by an electrified fence.Silage and hay made during Summer,is fed to animals in Winter,supplemented by bought-in barley,concentrates and straw. Home- grown vegetables,fruit and hedgerow berries are used for cooking. After calving surplus animals are sold at market,this being also a social event.
